llJsonSetValue.description: Returns, if successful, a new JSON text string which is json with the value indicated by the specifiers list set to value.If unsuccessful (usually because of specifying an out of bounds array index) it returns JSON_INVALID.An "out of bounds array index" is defined to be any Integer specifiers greater than the length of an existing array at that level within the Json text or greater than 0 (zero) at a level an array doesn't exist.A special specifiers, JSON_APPEND, is accepted which appends the value to the end of the array at the specifiers level. Care should be taken- if that level is not an array, the existing Value there will be overwritten and replaced with an array containing value at it's first (0) index.Contrary to lists and strings, negative indexing of Json arrays is not supported.If an existing "Key" is specifiers at that level, its Value will be overwritten by value unless value is the magic value JSON_DELETE. If a value does not exist at specifiers, a new Key:Value pair will be formed within the Json object. To delete an existing value at specifiers, use JSON_DELETE as the value. Note it will not prune empty objects or arrays at higher levels.If value is JSON_TRUE, JSON_FALSE or JSON_NULL, the Value set will be the bare words 'true', 'false' or 'null', respectively, at the specifiers location within json.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: source JSON data

parameters.name: specifiers
parameters.description: location of the of the value to be added, updated or deleted.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: new value or JSON_DELETE flag.

This function will delete protected key-value pairs only if the matching pass phrase is passed in the pass parameter. The function returns a list, the first entry in the list is the number of keys deleted, the second entry in the list is the number of keys that could not be deleted due to a non-matching pass phrase. llSubStringIndex.returns: that is the index of the first instance of pattern in source.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: what to search in (haystack)

parameters.name: pattern

llSetTextureAnim.description: Animate the texture on the specified face/faces by setting the texture scale and offset.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Mask of Mode flags

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: face number or ALL_SIDES

parameters.name: sizex
parameters.description: Horizontal frames (ignored for ROTATE and SCALE)

parameters.name: sizey
parameters.description: Vertical frames (ignored for ROTATE and SCALE)

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start position/frame number (or radians for ROTATE)

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Number of frames to display (or radians for ROTATE)

parameters.name: rate
parameters.description: Frames per second, or radians per second when ROTATE is set, or UV coordinates when SMOOTH is set (must not be zero)

llRotBetween.returns: that is the shortest rotation between the direction start and the direction end

llRequestPermissions.description: Ask agent for permissions to run certain classes of functions.

parameters.name: agent
parameters.description: avatar UUID that is in the same region

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: Permission mask (bitfield containing the permissions to request).

llSetKeyframedMotion.description: Specify a list of positions, orientations, and timings to be followed by an object. The object will be smoothly moved between those keyframes by the simulator.Collisions with other nonphysical or keyframed objects will be ignored (no script events will fire and collision processing will not occur). Collisions with physical objects will be computed and reported, but the keyframed object will be unaffected by those collisions. (The physical object will be affected, however.)

parameters.name: keyframes
parameters.description: Strided keyframe list of the form:* vector position (optional via KFM_TRANSLATION and KFM_DATA)* rotation orientation (optional via KFM_ROTATION and KFM_DATA)* float timeEach keyframe is interpreted relative to the previous transform of the object. Time values must be 1/9s. or greater. For example, consider the following list of keyframes: [<0, 0, 10>, ZERO_ROTATION, 5, <0, 0, 0>, ZERO_ROTATION, 5, <0, 0, -10>, ZERO_ROTATION, 5]This would cause the object to move up 10m over the course of 5s. It would then remain at the location for 5s before moving down 10m over the course of another 5s.An empty list will terminate any keyframed animation currently playing.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: modifiers and future options

llListSortStrided.returns: that is src sorted by the stride_index item in every stride.
llListSortStrided.description: llListSortStrided is llListSort with the added parameter of stride_index, adding the flexibility to sort by any item in the stride.  These routines use the same underlying code and have the same computational complexity.

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: List to be sorted.

parameters.name: stride_index
parameters.description: The index within the stride to sort by. stride_index is 0-indexed. The first element is 0, second 1, etc. An index of 0 is functionally identical to using llListSort.

parameters.name: ascending
parameters.description: if TRUE then the sort order is ascending, otherwise the order is descending.

llSetText.description: Displays text that hovers over the prim with specific color and translucency (specified with alpha).

llSetLinkTextureAnim.description: Animate the texture on the specified face/faces of the specified prim/prims by setting the texture scale and offset.  Identical to llSetTextureAnim except able to modify any prim in the link set.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: Link number (0: unlinked, 1: root prim, >1: child prims and seated avatars) or a LINK_* flag

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: bit field of Mode flags

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: face number or ALL_SIDES

parameters.name: sizex
parameters.description: horizontal frames (ignored for ROTATE and SCALE)

parameters.name: sizey
parameters.description: vertical frames (ignored for ROTATE and SCALE)

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start position/frame number (or radians for ROTATE)

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: number of frames to display (or radians for ROTATE)

parameters.name: rate
parameters.description: Frames per second, or radians per second when ROTATE is set, or UV coordinates when SMOOTH is set (must not be zero)

llSetLinkMedia.returns: that is a STATUS_* flag which details the success/failure of the operation(s).
llSetLinkMedia.description: Set the media params for a particular face on the linked prim(s) without a delay.

llUpdateKeyValue.returns: that can be used to identify the corresponding dataserver event to determine if this command succeeded or failed and the results.
llUpdateKeyValue.description: Start an asynchronous transaction to update a key-value pair associated with the script's Experience with the given key (k) and value (v).

parameters.name: checked
parameters.description: If TRUE the update will only happen if original_value matches the value in the key-value store.

parameters.name: original_value
parameters.description: The value to compare with the current value in the key-value store.

llTakeControls.description: Allows for intercepting of keyboard and mouse clicks, specifically those specified by controls, from the agent the script has permissions for.

parameters.name: controls
parameters.description: bitfield of CONTROL_* flags

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: boolean, determines whether control events are generated

parameters.name: pass_on
parameters.description: boolean, determines whether controls perform their normal functions

llMessageLinked.description: The purpose of this function is to allow scripts in the same object to communicate. It triggers a link_message event with the same parameters num, str, and id in all scripts in the prim(s) described by link.

parameters.name: num
parameters.description: Value of the second parameter of the resulting link_message event.

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: Value of the third parameter of the resulting link_message event.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Value of the fourth parameter of the resulting link_message event.

llTeleportAgentGlobalCoords.description: Teleports an agent to region_coordinates within a region specified by global_coordinates.A region's global coordinates can be retrieved using llRequestSimulatorData("region name", DATA_SIM_POS)If the destination is in the current region, the avatar will land facing look_at as a position within that region. Otherwise, look_at is treated as a unit direction.

parameters.name: agent
parameters.description: (the avatar to teleport, must be the owner)

parameters.name: global_coordinates
parameters.description: Global coordinates of the destination region. Can be retrieved by using llRequestSimulatorData(region_name, DATA_SIM_POS).

parameters.name: region_coordinates
parameters.description: where the avatar should land.

parameters.name: look_at
parameters.description: direction the avatar should be facing on landing (east, west, etc).

llRemoteLoadScriptPin.description: Copy script name into target and set to running with a start_param only if target's pin matches pin

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: prim UUID that is in the same region

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: a script in the inventory of the prim this script is in

parameters.name: pin
parameters.description: Must match pin set by llSetRemoteScriptAccessPin

parameters.name: running
parameters.description: boolean, if TRUE the script is set as running, if FALSE the script is not set as running

parameters.name: start_param
parameters.description: value returned by llGetStartParameter in the target script.
